DOC.brief_summary: Treatment of macular edema secondary to central retinal vein occlusion is more effective with combined therapy of bevacizumab and triamcinolone than bevacizumab alone.
DOC.brief_title: Treatment of Bevacizumab and Triamcinolone in Treatment or Macular Edema Secondary to CRVO
DOC.detailed_description: Comparison of two groups with different treatment with registrations of outcome in BCVA and complications
DOC.criteria: Macular edema secondary to central retinal vein occlusion BCVA worse than 20/40 Central macular >250 mc with OCT Diabetic retinopathy or other retinopathy Media opacity that does not allow following steroid responder diagnosed glaucoma or IOP > 21 mmHg
